text.tspan: The code in otbn_core_model.sv is designed to be
as minimal as possible, just tracking clock edges
and resets and passing all the work over DPI to the
otbn_model.cc translates from DPI calls to a more
object-orientated framework. It does a small amount
of "lifetime modelling", handling how we check things
at start/end of operation. It is also in charge of
translation between C++ types and SV DPI types.
The ISSWrapper class in iss_wrapper.h and
iss_wrapper.cc doesn't know much about OTBN.
Instead, it's in charge of managing the ISS process
and communication with that subprocess over
stepped.py is a script front-end for running the
ISS (similar to standalone.py, which is more
convenient on the command line). It implements a
simple REPL, converting text-mode commands from
stdin to Python calls and serializing results back to
Together with the other Python files in the sim/
directory, Sim.py forms the core of the instruction
set simulator, which is the golden reference model
